p: The future projections for the climate in northern Ghana paints a grim picture; temperatures will rise by 2.1–2.4 °C and annual rainfall figures are expected to decrease by 1.1% by 2020 and 20.5% by 2080 [ 8]. These changes will directly and negatively impact the water cycle and affect the lives and livelihoods of people, especially the poor and the vulnerable in society.
